q: Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.
h:
“Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
h:
“Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: If you've made a mistake, it's better just to laugh at it.
h:
“If you've made a mistake, it's better just to laugh at it.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
h:
“Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.” —
Epictetus

q: Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.
h:
“Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: The truth... It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.
h:
“The truth... It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience.
h:
“The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience.” —
Mark Manson

q: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
h:
“Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.” —
Richard Bach

q: Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
h:
“Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.
h:
“Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Attitude, not aptitude, determines altitude.
h:
“Attitude, not aptitude, determines altitude. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: What you become is far more important than what you get.
h:
“What you become is far more important than what you get.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Where violence reigns, reason is weak.
h:
“Where violence reigns, reason is weak.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: Those who attain the middle Dominate the whole.
h:
“Those who attain the middle Dominate the whole.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: We lie the loudest when we lie to ourselves.
h:
“We lie the loudest when we lie to ourselves.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: The only limits in your life are those that you set yourself.
h:
“The only limits in your life are those that you set yourself.” —
Celestine Chua

q: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
h:
“If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Being a good example is the best form of service.
h:
“Being a good example is the best form of service.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: A minute's success pays the failure of years.
h:
“A minute's success pays the failure of years.” —
Robert Browning

q: One mistake does not have to rule a person's entire life.
h:
“One mistake does not have to rule a person's entire life.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: The grass is greener where you water it.
h:
“The grass is greener where you water it.” —
Neil Barringham

q: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
h:
“Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.” —
Colin Powell

q: Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage.
h:
“Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: If you do not push the boundaries, you will never know where they are.
h:
“If you do not push the boundaries, you will never know where they are.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Rest in reason; move in passion.
h:
“Rest in reason; move in passion.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: He who knows best knows how little he knows.
h:
“He who knows best knows how little he knows.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Life is the dancer and you are the dance.
h:
“Life is the dancer and you are the dance.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: You don't have to control your thoughts; you just have to stop letting them control you.
h:
“You don't have to control your thoughts; you just have to stop letting them control you.” —
Dan Millman

q: Silence is sometimes the best answer.
h:
“Silence is sometimes the best answer.” —
Dalai Lama

q: TEAMWORK: the fuel that allows common people attain uncommon results.
h:
“TEAMWORK: the fuel that allows common people attain uncommon results.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
h:
“When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.” —
Carol Burnett

q: Help others for all the times that you have been ignored. Be kind to others, for all the times that you have been scorned.
h:
“Help others for all the times that you have been ignored. Be kind to others, for all the times that you have been scorned.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
h:
“Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life. ” —
Wayne Dyer
